quest.name: Krilled to Pieces
journal:
A happy ray is a productive ray, as Zukin well knows.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.
objectives: Feed the striped ray at krill swarms by using its Inhale ability.

dialogue.name: ZUKIN
dialogue.text: Fancy going for a little swim, Forename? If you have a moment to spare, Makura could use your help with the rays. They look after us, and so we must look after them.

dialogue.name: MAKURA
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename, I've been waiting for you. I need you to take one of our rays out for a good feed─a reward for all of its toils.

dialogue.name: MAKURA
dialogue.text: Now, the fellow loves few things more than krill, and you'll find swarms of them close by. Please have him feed till he's had his fill.

dialogue.name: MAKURA
dialogue.text: Should you become separated from the ray, worry not─he is trained to return here. Happy feeding, then, and let Zukin know when you're done!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The ray sucks in a copious amount of seawater and krill.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The ray sucks in a copious amount of seawater and krill.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The ray sucks in a copious amount of seawater and krill.

dialogue.name: MAKURA
dialogue.text: There you are! The ray returned without you, and he's been champing at the bit to get back to his krill.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: There is a large swarm of krill. You make a mental note of the spot for feeding the ray.

dialogue.name: ZUKIN
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename. I understand you treated the ray to a veritable banquet. This will doubtless do wonders for its spirit.

dialogue.name: ZUKIN
dialogue.text: Makura tells me the creature is very fond of you, and who could blame it? When next it needs a good feed, I trust we can rely on you again.

dialogue.name: MAKURA
dialogue.text: Our little ray returned with a belly full of krill and a grin from gill to gill! Thank you so much, Forename!
